string-array.name: factArray
string-array.item: A male bull walrus can weigh up to 2 tons.
Walruses turn their front flippers forward to aid in movement on land.
Walruses\' front flippers have five digits.
Male walruses have special air sacks to make bell-like noises.
Walruses eat clams, mussels and other bottom dwelling organism that they locate with their whiskers.
The worldwide walrus population is about 250,00 animals.
Walruses are very social and congregate in large numbers.
Sometimes walruses will eat carcasses of young seals when food is scarce.
Female and male walruses form different herds during non-breeding season.
